examples.target: No. If you are using crutches, it is advised to have non-slip shoes with a closed toe. Most sandals do not have non-slip traction and, by definition, don't have closed toes.  If you are in a leg cast you are likely to be using crutches.

examples.input: Did eggs need to be kept cold in the middle ages?
examples.target: No. When eggs are freshly laid, they are covered in a film called a 'bloom.' . Eggs with their bloom intact are able to stay at room temperature for one month. Pasteurization destroys the bloom on eggs.  Pasteurization was introduced in the 1990's.

examples.input: Is Krishna similar to Holy Spirit?
examples.target: Yes. The Holy Spirit is a Christian concept of a spirit that is an aspect or agent of God that does good in the world. Krishna, from Hinduism, is a manifestation of the God Vishnu. Krishna brings compassion, tenderness, and love into the world.

examples.input: In most Mennonite homes, would children know of The Powerpuff Girls?
examples.target: No. Mennonites are a religious with similar beliefs to Amish groups. Mennonites do not prohibit or view the use of technology as a sin. Most Mennonites avoid using television sets at home.

examples.input: Does Hanuman have some of the same duties as Athena?
examples.target: Yes. Hanuman, the divine Hindu monkey, is a god of strength, knowledge, and victory. Athena was the Greek goddess of war, and wisdom.

examples.input: Would Temujin hypothetically be jealous of Charlemagne's conquests?

examples.target: Yes. Immersion Baptism is the practice of submerging people underwater for a religious ritual. Jeff Buckley was an acclaimed singer that died of drowning in 1997. A baby in Moldova died from Immersion Baptism in 2010.

examples.input: Do sand cats avoid eating all of the prey of eels?
examples.target: No. Sand cats eat a number of animals including insects, birds, hares, and reptiles. Eels prey on fish, worms, frogs, and lizards. Lizards are a type of reptile.

examples.input: Are fossil fuels reducing jobs in the Gulf of Mexico?

examples.input: Did Gauss have a normal brain structure?
examples.target: No. When Gauss died in 1855, his brain was preserved for study. Dr. Rudolf Wagner, who studied the brain, found the mass to be slightly above average, and found highly developed convolutions on the brain.

examples.input: Is it common for women to have moustaches?
examples.target: No. Facial hair doesn't normally grow on women like it does on men. A little bit of hair can grow between the upper lip and nose but it's a very small amount and generally not enough to be noticeable.

examples.input: Did Demi Lovato's ancestors help turn maize into popcorn?
examples.target: Yes. Demi Lovato's father is Mexican. Maize is another word for corn. Corn was first domesticated in southern Mexico about 10,000 years ago. Popcorn is made from kernels of corn.

examples.target: Yes. La Femme Nikita is a French movie about a beautiful female assassin. Models are known for their beauty and height. Peta Wilson and Maggie Q have played the lead role in La Femme Nikita spinoffs. Peta Wilson and Maggie Q have both done extensive modeling work.

examples.input: Does the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom have poor job security?
examples.target: Yes. The Prime Minister of the United Kingdom is an elected official. Elected officials can be recalled with a vote of no confidence in UK parliament.

examples.input: Has type of political association Pompey had with Caesar influenced reality TV?

examples.input: Are the knights in the Medieval Times show not authentic knights?

examples.input: Could someone in a coma experience fear?
examples.target: No. Fear is induced when an individual feels threatened by something or someone. A person in a coma is unconscious and therefore cannot perceive their surroundings.

examples.input: Was Eve involved in an incestuous relationship?

examples.input: Are System of a Down opposed to globalization?

examples.input: Is March named after Jupiter's son in Roman mythology?
examples.target: Yes. March is named after the Roman god Mars. Mars was the son of the Roman gods Jupiter and Juno.

examples.input: Would you hire someone with dyscalculia to do surveying work?

Geometry and trigonometry are types of advanced mathematics.

examples.input: Is honey associated with queens?

examples.input: Would a kindergarten teacher make a lesson of the New Testament?
